@graph.rdfs:comment: Terms defined by the Publishing Working Group, to be used by the Web Publication Manifest
@graph.schema:creator: https://www.ivan-herman.net/foaf#me
@graph.schema:title: Web Publication Manifest Ontology

@graph.rdfs:comment: General type used for resources linked from the manifest.
@graph.rdfs:label: General type used for resources linked from the manifest.
Rel value for an accessibility report
Rel value for a cover page

@graph.rdfs:comment: Base direction of the publication and the infoset textual items
@graph.rdfs:label: Base direction

@graph.rdfs:comment: The list of extra resources enumerates all resources that are used in the processing and rendering of a Web Publication but are not within its bounds (i.e., are not listed in the default reading order or the resource list) but are, rather, external to the Web Publication.
@graph.rdfs:label: List of extra resources

@graph.rdfs:comment: The default reading order is a specific progression through a set of Web Publication resources.
@graph.rdfs:label: Default reading order

@graph.rdfs:comment: The reading progression establishes the reading direction from one resource to the next within a Web Publication.
@graph.rdfs:label: Reading progression direction

@graph.rdfs:comment: Equivalent to the rel attribute in HTML; uses either the IANA link registry data, or specially minted URL-s.
@graph.rdfs:label: Relation type

@graph.rdfs:comment: The resource list enumerates all resources that are used in the processing and rendering of a Web Publication (i.e., that are within its bounds) and that are not listed in the default reading order.
@graph.rdfs:label: Resource list

@graph.rdfs:comment: The total length of a time-based media resource in (possibly fractional) seconds.
@graph.rdfs:label: Resource level length

@graph.rdfs:comment: A cryptographic hashing of the resource that allows its integrity to be verified.
@graph.rdfs:label: Resource integrity
